item.title: Helldivers 2 is Making a Change to its Updates
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 devs aim to enhance game quality by spacing out patches for better monitoring and planning.
  • Recent updates focused on stability and bug fixes, avoiding drastic gameplay changes for player satisfaction.
  • Steam refunds reflect player discontent with mandatory PSN account linking restrictions, despite some improvements.

Helldivers 2 community manager Thomas Petersson announced that the developers will make changes to the release of patches to maintain the quality standard of the game. Since its launch in February 2024, Helldivers 2 has seen significant success, becoming Sony’s fastest-selling PlayStation game ever. The co-op shooter has enjoyed a steady stream of updates and content releases aimed at keeping the player base engaged.

The game, however, faced challenges, particularly with the speed of updates and balancing changes. Community feedback indicated that the frequent updates, while well-intentioned, often disrupted the game’s balance and removed elements of fun that players had discovered organically. This led to frustration among the player base and even an acknowledgment from Helldivers 2 director Johan Pilestedt that the approach to balancing had been overly aggressive at times.

Related
Steam is Refunding Helldivers 2 Players Even if They Have More Than 2 Hours of Playtime

Amid backlash, Steam grants Helldivers 2 refunds surpassing 2-hour limit, signaling significant discontent with PSN account linking mandate.

Helldivers 2 Devs Want To Ensure the Quality That Players Deserve

In a recent message on the Helldivers 2 Discord channel , Arrowhead community manager Thomas Petersson aka Twinbeard explained that the team plans to take more time with future patches. "We want to take some more time for this one and potentially between future patches, since we feel cadence has probably been a bit too high to be able to maintain the quality standard we want, and you deserve," Twinbeard said. The decision reflects a shift towards ensuring updates are thoroughly planned, implemented, and monitored to avoid the need for frequent hotfixes. This explanation came after the community manager said that the team needed more time for Helldivers 2 's next patch .

Despite these changes, the devs continue to address ongoing issues. The recent Helldivers 2 patch 1.000.304 , for instance, focused on fixing game crashes and bugs. This update did not include any new weapon or gameplay balance changes, instead prioritizing stability. The patch also introduced an optional setting for linking PSN accounts, following a controversial period where a mandatory PSN account link led to the game’s delisting in many countries.

Helldivers 2 has been partially relisted on Steam in several countries after being delisted due to Sony's controversial PSN account linking requirement for PC players. This decision regarding PSN linking initially led to the game's removal from over 170 countries, resulting in significant backlash and negative feedback from the community. Despite reversing the PSN account linking mandate, Helldivers 2 remains unavailable in many regions. However, territories such as American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands have seen the restrictions lifted, suggesting that Sony is beginning to address the game's global availability.

Twinbeard’s announcement has been positively received by the community, with many players urging the developers to take all the time necessary to ensure high-quality updates. Arrowhead’s strategy to slow down updates for Helldivers 2 highlights the importance of quality over quantity in game development.

item.title: Hunt: Showdown Has Bad News for PS4 and Xbox One Gamers
item.description:
Highlights

  • Crytek announces Hunt: Showdown will stop supporting PS4 and Xbox One on August 15, 2024, with upgrades for PS5 and Xbox Series X and S.
  • Players on old consoles can keep their progress and gear when they upgrade, with major game relaunch on August 15.
  • Hunt: Showdown GM David Fifield promises weekly updates leading to August 15, focusing on UI, progression, and player concerns.

Developer Crytek had some disappointing news for some console-based players of Hunt: Showdown , its horror-themed live service game. The news concerned further support for Hunt: Showdown on the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One platforms after the game's next major update.

Hunt: Showdown made waves upon its release as one of the best games made with CryEngine , Crytek's proprietary graphics and game development suite. The game pairs excellent visuals and tense combat with a unique twist on competitive first-person shooter gameplay. In Hunt: Showdown matches, players track down powerful, computer-controlled monsters to claim bounties for hunting them, while competing with other player-controlled bounty hunters. Unfortunately, Crytek disappointed players in September 2023, when it was announced that Hunt: Showdown would no longer support PS4 and Xbox One in April 2024.

Related
Hunt: Showdown – Best Legendary Hunters, Ranked

These are the finest legendary hunters in Crytek's first-person shooter, Hunt: Showdown.

However, that date came and went with no change to Hunt: Showdown 's playable platforms. On May 22, 2024, Crytek released a new video further clarifying its plans, and announced a new window for the end of PS4 and Xbox One support for the unique battle royale game .

Hunt: Showdown Loses PS4, Xbox One Support in August, Gets Free PS5, Xbox Series Upgrades

The developer update video was headed by Hunt General Manager David Fifield, who sought to dispel the confusion surrounding the future of Hunt: Showdown on PS4 and Xbox One. According to Fifield, the end date of support for previous-generation consoles is now set for August 15, 2024. On that date, Hunt: Showdown will be updated to use CryEngine 5.11, the latest version of the engine. Hunt: Showdown will be one of the first games to use CryEngine 5.11, though the company may opt to use a later version in its future projects, like the planned fourth Crysis game . After the August 15 update goes live on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X and S, Hunt: Showdown will be unplayable on PS4 and Xbox One.

Fifield was quick to assure current Hunt: Showdown players that players on PS4 and Xbox One will retain their accounts, progress, and all their entitlements, including the base game and any DLC. This means that existing players can play Hunt: Showdown on PS5 and Xbox Series X and S when they upgrade for no additional cost, while retaining their progress and their best Hunt: Showdown builds . Fifield also said that Crytek is treating the August 15 update as a major relaunch of the game, with new updates to the User Interface, progression systems, and other gameplay decisions.

The announcement also mentioned that Crytek will address further concerns and preview upcoming changes over the weeks and months between now and August 15, using a planned weekly video series, and other updates through official channels. Fifield encouraged players of Hunt: Showdown to tune in as the company reveals more about what it has planned for the game and addresses their questions moving forward.

item.title: Pokemon GO Players Give Important Tip for PvP and Raids
item.description:
Highlights

  • Blissey might not be the best choice for Raids or PvP battles in Pokemon GO, as it struggles to win.
  • Normal-types like Blissey are not super effective in Raids, making them bad picks for this gameplay element.
  • Blissey shines when defending Gyms in Pokemon GO, thanks to its high HP, making it hard for opponents to claim control.

Some Pokemon GO players have warned against using Blissey in Raids or PvP. Pokemon GO offers trainers different to test the strength of their teams. But while some Pokemon are solid choices available to Pokemon GO players, other monsters aren't among the most appealing options.

Pokemon GO trainers can test the power of their Pokemon by battling in the Ultra League, a very competitive Pokemon GO league that is unlocked when trainers have three Pokemon with CP 1,500 or higher. Pokemon GO trainers can also do Raid Battles, which is a Pokemon GO gameplay element equally popular. But unlike the mainline Pokemon games, the Pokemon GO meta isn't as broad when it comes to Pokemon being viable for PvP or Raids. With this in mind, some Pokemon GO players have warned about a choice other trainers should be wary of.

Related
Pokemon GO Player's Mom Makes Big Sacrifice for Her Kid

A Pokemon GO player completes a difficult feat thanks to the sacrifice their mom makes for them in-game, impressing fellow players.

Reddit user OneThousandLeftTurns asked if it would be worth using their Hundo Blissey in the Pokemon GO Ultra League, but trainers advised against it. One of the comments explained that Blissey is bad for PvP because although it's great for surviving, it's bad at winning. By way of comparison, the comment explained that all it takes to knock out a Blissey in the Great League is 5 Hydro Cannons from an unshielded Swampert. When asked if Blissey would then be useful in Pokemon GO Raids , the answer was also negative. The reason is that Normal-types aren't super effective against any type, making bad picks for raids.

Where Can Pokemon GO Trainers use Blissey?

Answering the OP's question about where Blissey can shine, players explained the Gen 2 monster shines when defending Pokemon GO Gyms . In Pokemon GO , players control Gyms and defend them with their Pokemon, but if they lose the battle, they lose control of the Gym to the trainer who defeated them. Since Blissey has the highest HP in Pokemon GO (496), it becomes the ideal Pokemon to absorb opponents' attacks, giving them a hard time claiming control of the Gym.

Defending a Gym is one of the ways players can obtain the coveted PokeCoins without spending real money. Pokemon GO players can earn 50 PokeCoins a day by successfully defending a Gym. With PokeCoins, trainers buy items in the Pokemon GO in-game store, such as Remote Raid Passes, Incense, Poke Balls, and Lure Modules. Another use for PokeCoins is to increase the Pokemon GO storage , allowing them to carry more items and Pokemon.

item.title: Poll Reveals Most Popular Character in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet
item.description:
Highlights

  • Results of recent poll reveal top characters in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, sparking debate among fans from various regions.
  • Kieran, Carmine, and Drayton rank high due to character development in The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero DLC storyline.
  • Forum users express diverse opinions on character rankings, questioning potential differences in poll results among western audiences.

The results are in from a recent poll of the most popular characters in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet . The poll was conducted by Nintendo DREAM, a gaming magazine published only in Japan, and the results are chafing Pokemon Scarlet and Violet fans from other regions.

Nintendo DREAM has been published in Japan since 1996, supporting Nintendo games as they come out. The Pokemon Scarlet and Violet DLC storyline The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero wrapped up earlier this year, and players have had their favorite characters grow and change in a few different ways, which makes the results of the poll all the more interesting.

Related
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet DLC's Terapagos Anime Theories Explained

Even without official news on Pokemon Scarlet and Violet's DLC, there are already several theories tying Terapagos to its new unnamed Pokemon.

In a post on the ResetERA forums , one user translated the poll results and posted only the top ten characters, but also provided information on a few honorable mentions. According to the DREAM poll, the top ten most popular characters in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet are as follows:

  1. Kieran
  2. Arven
  3. Rika
  4. Carmine
  5. Julianna/Florian (Player characters)
  6. Drayton
  7. Nemona
  8. Larry
  9. Grusha
  10. Iono

Version specific Pokemon Professors Turo and Sada placed 36th and 37th, respectively. The thread didn't appear to offer any reasoning or summary for why voters ranked one candidate over another, but it did attract many forum users with many different opinions on who should be where.

"Real ones know Larry is #1" declared one user, decidedly in the camp of the eternally tired Gym Leader and Elite Four member. "Rika was robbed of the top spot," another user said, referring to another member of the Elite Four who interviews the player before they can be challenged. But the most common opinions concerned the placement of Kieran, a character introduced in the Scarlet and Viole t DLC. Kieran, Carmine, and Drayton are all characters introduced in The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero, and some fans are theorizing that it's this recency throwing things off. Others cite the character development Kieran goes through during the DLC for his high ranking, but still others responded to his popularity in a less than positive fashion.

Parsing the Pokemon Popularity Poll

Users in the thread are curious about what the poll would look like if it was expanded to western audiences, rather than just the readers of Nintendo DREAM. Despite the small sample size the poll does provide an interesting look at how fans have received the newest generation, rather than seeing how much and of which Pokemon trainer fan art circulates the most. Either way, the presence of so many strong opinions regarding characters from Pokemon Scarlet and Violet is a good sign that Game Freak has made some fascinating narrative design choices that fans are passionate about.

item.title: Fortnite Reveals New Fallout Cosmetics Coming in Chapter 5 Season 3
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fallout cosmetics are coming to Fortnite in Chapter 5 Season 3, including skins like the Brotherhood of Steel's T-60 Power Armor.
  • The collaboration was confirmed following the success of the Fallout Prime Video series, boosting interest in the Fallout game series.
  • Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 will have a post-apocalyptic theme to align with the Fallout collaboration, starting on May 24 with new content.

Epic Games officially revealed some of the new Fallout cosmetics heading to Fortnite with the imminent launch of Chapter 5 Season 3: Wrecked. Sometime after the new season is live, Fortnite players will be able to participate in new events and acquire Fallout -themed skins and gear for a limited time.

The Fallout series is undergoing a resurgence of sorts, thanks to the successful premiere of the Fallout Prime Video series. The new Prime Video series boosted sales of Fallout 4 , and overall interest in the game is high due to the recent next-gen update for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S. While fans were waiting for the first Fallout 4 next-gen update in April, rumors of a Fortnite and Fallout collaboration began to circulate online. The release of the new TV show helped build anticipation among fans for a potential reveal of the new collaboration, and many suggested that Fallout could be the first collaboration for Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3. Confirmation finally arrived on May 17, with the official Fortnite Twitter account revealing new key art and stating that the Fallout collaboration was coming soon.

Related
Fortnite is Getting New Mod Types

The upcoming Fortnite season brings an entirely new theme, and it seems it will also introduce players to a different type of mod.

A short teaser clip was posted on the Fortnite Twitter account, revealing new Fallout cosmetics like the Brotherhood of Steel's iconic T-60 Power Armor for the upcoming collaboration. Players will likely be able to buy the new skin from the Item Shop once Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 is live. Multiple variants of the T-60 Power Armor skin were shown in the teaser clip, and one of the characters is firing what appears to be rounds from a Laser Rifle, which is one of Brotherhood of Steel's standard issue weapons in the Fallout series. However, Epic Games did not reveal any other details about the Fallout collaboration just yet.

Examining the Fortnite x Fallout Crossover

The new footage quickly garnered attention from Fallout fans and Fortnite players alike, with many analyzing it for more clues about what's to come in Chapter 5 Season 3. Some users point out that one of the weapons being fired in the clip is a combat shotgun from Fallout , while others believe a redesigned combat assault rifle may be coming in the new season as well. If prior leaks are true, players can also expect a brand-new vehicle in Fortnite this coming season.

Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 will begin on May 24 and introduce a post-apocalyptic theme to coincide with the Fallout collaboration. The scheduled downtime for Fortnite is worth noting as well, since players will not be able to access any of the new content from Chapter 5 Season 3 until maintenance is over.
